name: Ahome Awayfromhome
neighborhood_overview:
Ahome lies in the heart of the old city, the bubbling city centre of Antwerp.

Discover the Grote Markt with its mighty Renaissance Town Hall (UNESCO listed World Heritage site), the Groenplaats, the Gothic Cathedral of our Lady, the Rubens House, the Royal Museum of Fine Arts, the Museum of Contemporary Art (MUKHA), the Museum Plantin-Moretus/Prints Room(World Heritage Site), the Museum At the Stream (MAS), the Kloosterstraat with its antique & brocante shops, the Nationale straat : thÃ© fashion street with its world famous designer shops and the Fashion Museum (MoMu), the Zoo, the Central Station (nicknamed: the Railway Cathedral), its traffic free shopping streets and last but not least: a myriad of star restaurants as well as simple Belgian and ethnic eateries, fresh markets, culinary shops, theatres, bars and a vibrant nightlife.

If you have a car: you can reach the freeway to Brussels (E19 and A12) in 5 minutes. Street parking is easy to find and is free from 19:00pm till 9:00am, on Sundays and Public Holidays. There is a cheap underground public parking (Vinci Parking Nationale Bank) within 50 meters, open 24/7.

name: sunny rooftop apartment, sleeps 2-5
neighborhood_overview:
It is a mixed cultural neighborhood. A lot of young people moved in, providing a new vibe. New restaurants, cafes, shops pop up all the time.
So they call the neighborhood BOHO.
There is a beautiful art deco cinema turned into a cultural centre a bit further. Check the program of 'De Roma' for concerts, films etc.

On the ground floor of the apartment building is a handy small supermarket. Other shops like fresh bakery, butcher, fish are around the corner on the Turnhoutsebaan.

On Friday morning you will find local produce at the vegetable and fruit market at the church of Laar (which you can see from the terrace).

Hop on tram 10 or go for a walk to Zurenborg neighborhood with its famous Cogels-Osylei dotted with dazzling art deco houses.

name: Authentic and very light studio in Antwerp
neighborhood_overview:
The north side of Antwerp used to be a place to skip when visiting Antwerp. It is not anymore. On the contrary, the vicinity of Park Spoor Noord now offers the opportunity to relax while having a peaceful picnic, but also to enjoy nightlife by going to the summer bar (Bar Noord) or the multiple galleries that are nearby. More into a relaxing day at the spa or just a refreshing swim? The most beautiful (Art Nouveau) swimming pool annex bathing house is literally around the corner.
For those coming to Antwerp for a show or concert at Het Sportpaleis or Lotto Arena, our place is ideal to avoid the traffic jams, as it is only a 5 minute walk door to door.

Still close to the ancient city centre, our neighborhood is a very interesting one to live in and start your journey from.

name: NEW - Quiet loft in city center w/ private parking
neighborhood_overview:
All musea, the river Scheldt, restaurants, bars, shops ... are at walking distance from our apartment. The area is specifically known for its art galeries.
Antwerp has a lot to offer: city on the Scheldt, city of Rubens, of diamonds, a fashionista's dream with world-renowned designers, a port city, impressive architecture and splendid art... Antwerp is a vibrant, welcoming metropolis, which is also great fun and heart-warming, with green areas where you can relax, and peaceful corners. The cafes only serve the best beers and foodies can enjoy delicious traditional and multicultural cuisine.
Antwerp is also a perfect starting point to visit other Belgian cities like Brussels (30 mins), Ghent (30 mins), Bruges (60 mins),... but also Amsterdam (1,5 hrs), Paris (2 hrs) and London (2,5 hrs) are nearby.
After your city visit(s), our apartment offers you complete rest and shelter.

name: aplace/antwerp: gorgeous flat with square view
neighborhood_overview:
Aplace/antwerp is situated in the middle of the old town of Antwerp. On the corner of â€˜de Groenplaatsâ€™ and the Big Market, the designer shops (the famous Dries van Noten shop is around the corner) and the â€˜Kloosterstraatâ€™, known for its antique en curiosa. The ideal spot to discover Antwerp!

THE AUCTION ON FRIDAY
De Vrijdagmarkt is a quiet square that hasnâ€™t been discovered by the big audience yet and ideal to meet local Antwerp people. Very unique and traditonal is the weekly auction on - fridays - on the â€˜Vrijdagmarktâ€™. Here you can buy for a cheap price exclusive, retro and sometimes even valuable objects.

PLANTIN-MORETUS MUSEUM
When staring out of your windows you'll see the beautifully enlightened building of the Museum Plantin-Moretues. The only printing/publisher in the world from the Renaissances and baroque time which has kept remained and the only museum in the world on the UNESCO World Heritage list - so for sure a must see!

DESI

name: Cosy apartment in historic house
neighborhood_overview:
Dit is de absolute topbuurt van Antwerpen. Centraler kan je niet vinden. Je stapt buiten en je komt meteen in een gezellige winkelwandelstraat.
Overal zijn er leuke restaurants, lounge-bars, cafÃ©'s en winkeltjes. De Grote Markt met de historische gildehuizen, het stadhuis en het bekende Brabo-standbeeld, iets verder de Kathedraal en als je de straat uitloopt zit je op de oevers van de Schelde waar je 's zomers gezellig kan vertoeven op het ponton.

Als je graag gaat shoppen dan zit je hier op de beste locatie van Antwerpen. Je bevindt je hier namelijk vlak aan de befaamde modebuurt van Antwerpen. De beroemdste designers hebben hier hun ateliers en winkels in de Nationalestraat, Kammenstraat.
In principe is alles op wandelafstand dankzij de formidabele ligging van het appartement.
Uiteraard zijn er ook andere mogelijkheden zoals trams en metro's. Het metrostation vind je onder de Groenplaats en dus slechts op 500m van het appartement.

name: Cosy modern studio city-center WIFI & parking
neighborhood_overview:
History of the Â« Eilandje Â» :

Eilandje started around 1550 and is the oldest port of Antwerp. In the 19th century, Napoleon Bonaparte had the first two docks excavated for an important naval base. This is followed by an intense flowering period in which several other docks will be excavated.
In the 20th century the port activities shift to the North. Most people move away and the Â« Eilandje Â» is a deserted area between port and city.

At the end of the 20th century, one can see the potential of the abandoned docks, quays and warehouses. The city writes, together with the organization "City on the River" an international architectural competition and in the early 1990s the Spanish architect Manuel de SolÃ -Morales draws an initial plan for The Island. In 1997 RenÃ© Daniel's works out concrete plans for the Old Docks, the Montevideo district and the Cadix district. In 2002 the Â« Eilandje Â» gets its own Master Plan.

name: Appartement near Central Station
neighborhood_overview:
The appartement is situated in a family house near Central Station, the Antwerp Zoo, China Town and the UGC cinema complex.
Although the street itself is relatively quiet, there's a lot going on in the neigbourhood: a lot of artists and creative people live here, there are art galleries, alternative restaurants, excellent coffee bars, authentic music cafÃ©s and much more. The big city park Spoor Noord and the more cosy Krugerpark (both with lovely playgrounds) are nearby.
Just around the corner a shopping street provides a nice supermarket with a big range of organic products and a pharmacy.
My personal favourites: the Art Deco city swimming pool (Veldstraat), CafÃ© Kiebooms: a beautiful 1920's jazz bar with live gigs; and Klappei: a tiny old cinema in the street behind us.

name: Charming, bright apartment
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is characterised by 19th-century townhouses and hosts a lovely park with a playground and a very nice child-friendly cafÃ© just next to it. Restaurants, coffeebars and cafÃ©s are just a stroll away (5 - 10 minutes).

As for parking space, there are two options: either find a spot near the house and pay for it (Monday through Saturday from 8 AM until 7 PM, daily rate 3,80 euros) or leave your car for free in the parking area on the Desguinlei (where the Desguinlei, the Kielsevest and the Lange Elzenstraat meet) at a walking distance of 5 - 10 minutes.

name: Stay in the shoppinghart of Antwerp
neighborhood_overview: Within minutes you are in the vibrant main shopping area of Antwerp : Meir. There is also a large supermarket with organic and healthfood 100 m walk from the appartment.

name: Lux Loft in the heart of Historic Antwerp
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounding the loft there are multiple restaurants, sandwich bars, bakeries and the most cosy sunny terraces from Antwerp!
Right outside are already amazing Bars and cafees. Jazz bar "de Muze" brings a art deco style back to life and " Het Pelikaantje" is a typical brown cafe were the locals love to hang out for a beer and chat after work. Two breakfast places or right there too.
The big shopping area with â€œThe Meir" is only 3 min from the front door but starts right outside with some vintage, retro shops. The supermarket "Carrefour" is in the basement of the Shopping Center Grand Bazar and is about a minute walk away.
If you love Belgian chocolates, then don't forget to visit Quetzal on the Lijnwaadmarkt. A chocolate bar that brings enjoying chocolate to a whole new level!

name: Apartment in historic center - 2nd
neighborhood_overview:
You can find really everything within one kilometer! Museums, picturesque streets, churches, bars, markets, shopping streets, restaurants ...
This is one of the nicest parts of Antwerp!

It takes you a five minutes walk to find the magnificent Cathedral of Our Lady, the old square (Grote Markt) or Green Square (Groenplaats).
At 200m are the Rockoxhouse, St. Anne chapel or the Late Gothic St. James church.
You can visit a lot of museums nearby including the Rubens House, the MAS or the Museum Plantin-Moretus .
Also for shopping there can not be a better location! The famous Meir is just around the corner, the area around the National Street and the Fashion Museum is only 10 minutes away.

name: Trendy Apartment - "ZUID"
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment lies in the peaceful Willem Lepelstraat (car-free part, which is quite helpful for your night rest;)). On one side of the Willem Lepelstraat, you can find the famous "Nationalestraat", where several designer stores are located. On the other side, the Willem Lepelstraat borders the "Kloosterstraat", which is known for its cosy coffee bars as well as antique/vintage stores.
Walk 2 min further down the Kloosterstraat and you will find the "Vlaamse and Waalse kaaien", that are filled with bars and restaurants.
On 5 min walking distance from the apartment, there is also a Delhaize supermarket.

name: Cosy home, excellent location!
neighborhood_overview:
The Coquilhatstraat is a straight street which is part of the original allotment of 1875 of this part of town. The street is situated between the Zwijger- and the Verbondstraat and is seperated by the De VriÃ¨restraat. Historically the name of the street was Vaderlandstraat but was renamed in 1891 after AimÃ© Coquilhat (1853-1891) who was vice governor of the former Belgian colony.
The Coquilhatstraat has the typical profile of a street at 'the Zuid', with a construction of late 19th century neoclassical cornices alternated with brick gables and with a monumental building as eyecatcher (source: inventaris onroerenderfgoed).

name: TOOG (ecofriendly loft apartment)
neighborhood_overview: De buurt is altijd levendig en bruisend, dicht bij alles bij (shoppen, cultuur, uitgaan), met vele restaurants en cafe's in de buurt.  Het MAS museum is de nieuwe parel in Antwerpen en dit op 500 m van het appartement.  In de buurt zijn te veel goede restaurants om ze allemaal op te noemen, maar NIMMAN ( aziatisch), DE BURGERIJ ( hamburger) en MON (luxe dining) zijn onze favorieten.  Voor een leuk en gezellig avondje op cafe zijn CLODETTE en HESSENHUIS zeker aan te raden.  de vele Antwerpse zomerbars zijn zeker ook een aanrader, zo zijn er in de buurt, CARGO in park spoor noord (minder dan 1 km afstand) en BOCADERO, aan de scheldekaaien ( Max 1 km afstand)

It takes you a five minutes walk to find the magnificent Cathedral of Our Lady, the old square (Grote Markt) or Green Square (Groenplaats).
At 200m are the Rockoxhouse, St. Anne chapel or the Late Gothic St. James church.
You can visit a lot of museums nearby including the Rubens House, the MAS or the Museum Plantin-Moretus .
Also for shopping there can not be a better location! The famous Meir is just around the corner, the area around the National Street and the Fashion Museum is only 10 minutes away.

name: â­ï¸Stylish Bright Apt âœ”2 BR âœ”2 Patio âœ”Free â“…
neighborhood_overview:
The "Eilandje" district is the oldest port area in Antwerp and is surrounded by water. Today the port activity is more concentrated in the north, but the port feeling still dominates here. Taste the old atmosphere of the unloading quay with monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones.

For good food, you can undoubtedly find something in one of the many and various eateries in the area. The historic city center is a 20-30 minute walk, where there is an even greater range of food and drink, shopping, entertainment and culture.

The MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House are not to be missed in the immediate vicinity, and underline the connection between the city and the water.

name: Green garden apartment, terrace, near Zurenborg
neighborhood_overview:
Within walking distance you can find:
- Central Station
- art-nouveau neighborhood Cogels-Osylei
- Zurenborg, a neighborhood with lots of restaurants, bars and playgrounds
- central park, to relax, go jogging, take a picnic, playground

- shopping area Meir
- Moorkensplein

There is a discount for bookings from 1 week or 1 month.

2 min walk to public bikes ( "Antwerp velo"). You can rent a bicycle for 4 euro a day there, or 9 euro for a week.
Antwerp Theatre is 1.5 km from the apartment. You can take a tram to the "Grote Markt" from tram stop Antwerp "Lente", which is a 4-minute walk. This tram will take you to the historic centre in just 11 minutes.

name: Great city, great apartment, great location!
neighborhood_overview:
Ideally situated near all the major attractions and then some.
Shopping? Explore the Meir, Wilde Zee area and for the die hard fashionistas the Nationale & Kammenstraat where all the famous names have their flag ship stores (Dries Van Noten, A.F. Vandevorst, Veronique Branquinho,..)
Visit the historical centre round the Cathedral, City Hall, het Steen. After stumbling over the cobbly stones, treat yourself to the local beer, a Bolleke.
Off the beaten track: the Zurenborg area, ecclectic Jugendstil follies, with the hipsteresque Dageraad Plaats nearby.
Yes, Antwerp has it all & more
Travel back in time and explore the Rubens House, grand manor of the world famous painter slash diplomat par excellence Rubens. Marvel at the grand paintings and the short canopy bed, where the master took his power naps sitting up.

Antwerp is yours to discover...& so is my apartment.

The Great Square Market, the Cathedral and the historical city centre are only five minutes by foot. You can also easily visit the trendy Eilandje and MAS with lots of restaurants, bars and nice views. In the evening, when the sun goes down, we really recommand a visit to the riverbanks of 'Schelde'. It's really amazing to see the sun go down. It's a five minutes walk to get to the river banks and the 'Steen' for example, where you have a stunning view.

Een gezellige en rustige buurt en toch vlakbij Antwerpen centrum, wijk Zurenborg of het Zuid.
Vanuit station Antwerpen Berchem (2.5 km) geraak je overal met de trein.
Met de tram ben je snel op de Meir of de Nationalestraat, waar je naar hartenlust kan shoppen.

Tevens een zeer groene buurt met tal van parken op een steenworp van het appartement: Boekenbergpark (100m) heeft een zwemvijver en speeltuin, Boelaerpark (100m) heeft een speeltuin, Rivierenhof (2.5 km) is met zijn 3.2 ha het grootste park van Antwerpen.
Veel musea bereikbaar met tram of bus: M HKA, MAS, Rubenshuis, Red Star Line museum, Diamantmuseum, ...

name: top floor 100y old townhouse Antwerp North
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is an eclectic neighbourhood with shops, green area's, highways and public transport closeby (10min tram to Antwerp Central)

PUBLIC TRANSPORT: The easiest way to get here is to take the train to Antwerp Central station. From there on you can take a metro at koningin ASTRIDplein, it's the square in front of the central station. You can take numbers 2,3 or 6, in the direction of Merksem. It will take you 12minutes - 5 stops, the stop where you get of is 'GASTHUISHOEVE', it's very easy, it's the stop after sportpaleis, it's the first stop in open air. arriving at gasthuishoeve, you are standing in my street, it's just a 250m walk down the street. I always use google maps, button public transport to calculate my route. If you have any difficulty finding your way, please whatsapp me, and I will guide you here!

The holiday home for 10 people is located in the historic center of Antwerp

- VRIJDAGMARKT (FRIDAY MARKET)
A piece of Provence in Antwerp with nice cafÃ©s, terraces and with the UNESCO World Heritage Museum of Plantin-Moretus. On Friday morning, the square changes into an outdoor auction of old items and furniture.

- GROENPLAATS
One of the most famous squares of Antwerp with a cozy atmosphere, cafÃ©s and restaurants dominated by the beautiful Cathedral of our Lady

- GROTE MARKT
with the impressive building of the Town Hall and the statue of Brabo is overlooking the scenery.

- KLOOSTERSTRAAT
Well known street for antiques, brocante, vintage and interior design shops. De Kloosterstraat is also worth visiting on Sunday when all the shops are open.

name: Ground floor apartment with huge garden!
neighborhood_overview: Welcome in "2060" (the postal code of this area)! A great, lively neighbourhood close to the central station (10 min walk) and the city center (15 min walk). Also, if you plan on attending an event at Sportpaleis or Lotto Arena, this is just a 20 min walk or a 10 min tram ride away. In the neighbourhood itself, you'll find a lot of shops and restaurants, with tastes from all over the world. As Antwerp has about 164 nationalities living in the city (more than New York!!) this is where you can find them. Exotic restaurants side by side with traditional Belgian pubs and Eastern European supermarkets. Looking for something? Sure you can find it here!

name: Antwerp Historic City Centre (RS39)
neighborhood_overview:
50 meter from the Groenplaats and Cathedral in the historic centre. Round the corner you will walk into the Meir, the Nationalestraat and Kammenstraat - the shopping walhalla!

Supermarket at 120m - under the KBC Tower

You are in the middle of restaurants, authentic bars, and historic places of interest. Do not forget to stroll next to the river Schelde or visit 'het steen'.

You will receive more tips and a 'homemade' walking route, which will amaze you with streets and curiosities where no other tourist will go.

During weekend we recommend the Vogelmarkt and Vreemdelingenmarkt, where you can drink a glass (or more) Cava or do your groceries ...

name: at HOME
neighborhood_overview:
The Markgrave district is a major neighborhood that was aimed at a wealthy bourgeoisie of magistrates, traders, artists, renters and unmarried ladies in the 19th century.
In terms of typology, the classic citizen's home dominates the basement or bell-floor. It is a stately quarter where streets like Markgravelei, Bosmanslei, Arthur Goemaerelei and Van Putlei are distinguished by the residential, monumental buildings of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The chic facades of the neighborhood tell the glorious past of the neighborhood.
The Hof van Leysen and the Domain Hertoghe form open green areas that break the dense building. The St. Laurentius church adds a monumental accent to the scenography of the street.

name: Spacious Suite in Antwerp
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is generally somewhat calmer and more residential, but it's a stone's throw away from all the action in the tourist centre of Antwerp. In summertime more activities take place in the direct vicinity, ranging from urban gardening to an actual neighbourhood bar serving unique Antwerp beers, etc. - summer is when our neighbourhood really comes to life. We are proud of our tight-knit community and go the extra mile to maintain a close relationship with neighbours.

name: Cozy Apartment on Most Central Location in Antwerp
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of cafÃ©-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. name: Lofty style apartment
neighborhood_overview:
I love living is this lively colourful neighbourhood. Right in the heart of the 2060 district , close to the train station and
historical city centre, this area offers you a real taste of the Antwerp life. At walking distance you will find excellent Asian restoâ€™s, a cool coffee bar, a cosy bar and the city library.

You can stroll towards Park Spoor Noord, where you can enjoy some greenery or hang out at the local bars/restoâ€™s. From there you can make your way towards â€˜het eilandjeâ€™, where culture in all it forms are to be found ( MAS - Red Star Line museum, ...)

Every third Sunday of the month (except during Nov - Dec - Jan - Feb) one can enjoy the comics and books market underneath my place at the De Coninckplein

You will find everything your travellers heart desires

name: Spacious apartment at 'Den Dam' for two
neighborhood_overview:
Precious new life was breathed into an abandoned 24-hectare railway marshalling yard in 2008/9 when the Park Spoor Noord opened. Now a large panoramic green park emphasising greenery, light, space, leisure, culture, sport and events.
It boasts play areas, a spectacular BMX and skate bowl, two cooling water fountains for children to splash in and a shelter with a temporary summer terrace, run by Bar Cargo, which sees the trendy set settling in - in the summer! Antwerpers sun their bodies, play and relax in this gem of a park - Park Spoor Noord, almost unimaginable in a city.

Het Antwerpse Zuid kenmerkt zich door zijn art-deco stijl. Hier zijn tal van restaurants en cafÃ©'s aanwezig. In deze wijk ga je de kleinere en unieke boetieks vinden i.p.v. de grote winkelketens.

Enkele zÃ©Ã©r populaire musea (Museum van Schone Kunsten, Fotomuseum, Modemuseum) liggen vlakbij.
De Volkstraat is dan weer gekend voor zijn unieke horeca zaken, winkels (check Steen en Been) en zijn breedte van de straat waardoor dit een prachtig zicht geeft op het nieuwe Vlinderpaleis (Justitiepaleis).

name: Modern and spacious studio in the City Centre-70m2
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is very diverse and lively, you can do everything by foot. You can find coffee, vinyl, local shops on a stone's throw.
You can start a wonderful stroll from the new Port House (designed by Zaha Hadid) via the Red Star Line museum, through the Marina in the direction of the MAS museum and the Port Pavilion. Enjoy the wide range of terraces and eateries in this neighbourhood before continuing your walk to the centre city. You can choose if you continue your walk next to the water and visit 'Het Steen' or through the little streets of Antwerp to enjoy the beautiful facade of the Town hall, the Brabo statue to go the cathedral and to get lost in the shopping streets in the Groenplaats neighbourhood.

name: Antwerpen quiet appartment in green surroundings
neighborhood_overview: The house is in front of a beautiful park with a pond that continues into the larger green zone of the Sorghvlietpark and fort 8, ideal for walking, jogging or cycling. At the same time the Kioskplaats, the main square of Hoboken where the trams leave, with numerous shops, banks and bars is only 100 meters away. The river Scheldt with ferry boats and the nature park De Hobokense polder is about 1.5 kilometers away. You can take tram 4 to the historic centre or tram 2 to the Central Station, or use the system of city bikes. There's  also a train to centre or a ferry on the nearby river Scheldt to the other side of the river or to Antwerp centre

name: Maison Emile - Executive Room
neighborhood_overview:
Maison Emile is situated in a quiet, yet central place in the bustling city of Antwerp, the largest city of Flanders. A true metropolis, with one of the biggest harbors in the world, but everything is on a human scale. Architecture, fashion, culture, shopping, all go hand in hand. A visit to Antwerp is something you will never forget, especially when you combine it with a visit in Maison Emile.

There is a tramway, right in front of our door. In just a few minutes it will bring you to all of Antwerpâ€™s landmarks: The central station (declared the most romantic city in the world), the Zoo or our famous shopping street the Meir.

name: Complete house | 14 people | Antwerp City Center
neighborhood_overview:
The holiday home for 14 people is located in the historic center of Antwerp

You stay in Lange Riddersstraat, a quiet street in the Fashion District, a few steps from:

- VRIJDAGMARKT (FRIDAY MARKET)
A piece of Provence in Antwerp with nice cafÃ©s, terraces and with the UNESCO World Heritage Museum of Plantin-Moretus. On Friday morning, the square changes into an outdoor auction of old items and furniture.

- GROENPLAATS
One of the most famous squares of Antwerp with a cozy atmosphere, cafÃ©s and restaurants dominated by the beautiful Cathedral of our Lady

- GROTE MARKT
with the impressive building of the Town Hall and the statue of Brabo is overlooking the scenery.

- KLOOSTERSTRAAT
Well known street for antiques, brocante, vintage and interior design shops. De Kloosterstraat is also worth visiting on Sunday when all the shops are open.

- FASHION DISTRICT
With many renowned designers of the Antwerp

Midden "historisch centrum" bedoeld midden erin. De grote markt, de groenplaats, Carolus Bortholemeus kerk, de kathedraal het zijn allemaal buren. Ben je gekomen om te schoppen (meir, huidevettestraat, wilde zee, ea), ook dit is allemaal bereikbaar binnen onze cirkel van 15 minuten.

name: Luxurious Condo in Antwerp (incl. Indoor Parking)
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is in one of the most beautiful suburbs of Antwerp close to the major parks of the city.

It is very close by to 'Den Brandt Park', 'Nightingale Park' and 'Middelheim Park', the latter full of art monuments (free entrance). These parks are among the most beautiful of Flanders and definitely the most beautiful of Antwerp.
Across the street you'll find a Carrefour Express. Within 100m you can find a pharmacy, a grocer, a fishmonger, a fromagerie, a pizzeria, a winery, a chip shop and a Chinese.

Next door, on the corner of the street, one finds a nice Italian restaurant (La Tavola Italiana). In Den Brandt Park (in the former coach house of the castle) you have the amazing restaurant Danieli il Divino, in a gorgeous setting with great staff and a fantastic menu, it's simply never disappointing!

Wilrijk is also home to the largest Jain Temple (outside of India) constructed totally out of imported white marble.

From the apartment it is about 4 km to the city center of Antwerp which takes you 15 min by bike or by public transport. The beautiful parks and Middelheim open air art museum are a couple of streets away. Good combo of city buzz and green.
There are great restaurants close-by and a bakery & supermarket around the corner.

name: Luxurious Authentic Apartment
neighborhood_overview: After having lived in various places in Antwerp for fifteen years, I have chosen this very quiet, perfectly situated and beautiful neighborhood. You have both front and rear view only and only green. You can see from the balcony at the back of the apartment on the gardens of the Van Putlei, one of the most beautiful streets of Antwerp. In this street you will find the most majestic mansions of Antwerp. In the summer you only see trees, but in the winter the gigantic rear facades adorn the view. Via this Van Putlei you walk into Antwerp South and via the Hof van Leysen you pass the cafÃ© Kamil, a cozy trendy brasserie that allows you to enjoy your drink in the park. Most of Antwerp's major parks are all nearby, with Middelheim Park, a unique and large open air museum. Furthermore, park Den Brandt and the picturesque Hof van Leysen.

name: Authentic family house
neighborhood_overview:
The north side of Antwerp used to be a place to skip when visiting Antwerp. It is not anymore. On the contrary, the vicinity of Park Spoor Noord now offers the opportunity to relax while having a peaceful picnic, but also to enjoy nightlife by going to the summer bar (Bar Noord) or the multiple galleries that are nearby. More into a relaxing day at the spa or just a refreshing swim? The most beautiful (Art Nouveau) swimming pool annex bathing house is literally around the corner.
For those coming to Antwerp for a show or concert at Het Sportpaleis or Lotto Arena, our place is ideal to avoid the traffic jams, as it is only a 5 minute walk door to door.

Still close to the ancient city centre, our neighborhood is a very interesting one to live in and start your journey from.

name: Discover Antwerp, start in a beautiful apartment!
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in one of the nicest neighborhoods, only 10 minutes walk to "de Singel" if you want to pick a jazz concert, dance or theater show. There are 3 beautiful parks around the apartment, and beer brewery " De Koninck" is only 5 minutes walk. There are a few nice coffee bars in the streets around if you want to have a good breakfast to start the day. Also there is a bike stations right next to the building (Red Velo's) where you can pick a bike to get around. City center, shopping area's, museums and lots of unique landmark are only 15 min by bike, 30 min walk or 20 min by tram. Lots of nice (wine) bars and restaurants are so close, you can walk every where if you love to discover this beautiful city.

name: House with 4 bedrooms & garden @ hip Antwerp South
neighborhood_overview:
Antwerp South district is famous for its art and fashion. The big five worked and lived here. You'll find a lot of hip and international restaurants, lunch, coffee, wine and cocktailbars but also authentic Flemish / Antwerp cafÃ©s at walking distance from the house.
In the Nationalestraat you'll find the hippest (popup) clothing stores, and the Kloosterstraat invites you to discover all latest vintage or other furniture and art on Sundays.
The Antwerp historic city centre is at walking distance and the Red Star Line museum in the north of the city is at 15min. by bike.
Get a breath of fresh air after a long day at the quay, with a view of the Scheldt.

name: Gezellige hideout nabij Spoor Noord en Eilandje
neighborhood_overview:
We wonen in de zelf verklaarde Natie-buurt. Vlakbij Park Spoor Noord en het Eilandje. Op de plek waar nu Spoor Noord gevestigd is, lag het oude trein-rangeerstation. Via dit station en de dokken op het eilandje kwamen goederen vanuit de hele wereld. Die werden (onder andere) in deze buurt opgeslagen en verhandeld in de 'Naties'. Als je door de straten loopt zal je een mix van woningen en oude industriepanden vinden die deze geschiedenis nog een beetje prijsgeven.
Tegenwoordig bevindt zich hier een grote gemeenschap Portugesen. Je vindt hier allerlei typische Portugese eetcafÃ©tjes (Espiguero, Estrela Do Mar), maar ook leuke koffiebarretjes (Brandbar) en heerlijk lunchrooms (Le Red Fox, De Natie, Crumbles & Beans). Op wandelafstand van het mooiste Art Nouveau station van Europa (misschien wel de wereld) en de Meir. Het bruisende Eilandje bereik je op 5 minuten wandelen.

name: The House on Kleine Goddaard, great 4 large groups
neighborhood_overview:
The location really is perfect and beautiful. The Mas Museum is less then a 10 minute walk from here, and you can actually see it from our rooftop terrace.

The Cathedral, city hall, The Schelde, and the main shopping area are even closer by.

There's a delicious Thai take away restaurant right opposite of our house. There's also a genuine Italian restaurant + few of Antwerps hot spot restaurants/lunch rooms are literally right next door.

The very famous fish store NADA is opposite our house and there's a Delhaize across the street that's open 7 days a week from 8am to 8pm. There's a Velostation + a really fun Drag performance bar with drag performances every Tuesday, Thursday, Friday and sunday. (Happy hour from 11pm to 12am)

There's also some amazing shops nearby.

The red light district is also just a 5 minute walk away.

name: The Cosy, Cute cosy room Historical Center Antwerp
neighborhood_overview:
Smack in the middle of the historic center of Antwerp. The Mas-museum is a 5-minute walk away, 'Onze Lieve Vrouw'-Cathedral is only 4 minutes away. The iconic town hall and the Schelde at 3 minutes and the main shopping streets are also less than a 5 minute walk away.

A very beautiful church can also be visited in the street opposite us. free of charge. In the street itself there's a few nice cafes and cool shops (the street is known for its second-hand shops) - lots of breakfast and lunch options and a nice croquette bar. There is a washing salon and a large Delhaize supermarket right on the corner that is open 7 to 7 open from 8 to 8 even on holidays.

And then there's these amazing restaurants and delicacies that are just located next to us.
And if you need a hairdresser a barber or a makeup artist you just need to walk outside.

Trendy and Classic coming together in this area, and there is certainly something to find for everyone.

name: Spacious apartment - B&B InterMezzo near parc.
neighborhood_overview:
Vlakbij vindt u concertzalen Trix, De Roma, Rataplan, OLT Rivierenhof en het Sportpaleis. Met de tram die zich op 5' wandelen bevindt bent u op 10' in het centrum van Antwerpen. Eveneens met de (huur) fiets bereikt u makkelijk het centrum.
U verblijft op wandelafstand (5') van een enorme groene oase zijnde het park Rivierenhof met de mogelijkheid om te wandelen, 's morgens te joggen of te genieten van het prachtig terras aan de vijver van het parkkasteel.
Het Wijnegem Shoppingcenter is makkelijk te bereiken.
Er zijn op wandelafstand gezellige restaurants, authentieke cafÃ©'s en supermarkten.

Top location in de old centre of the city. All historic buildings nearby. Beautiful restaurants, shops and museums.
Parking: there is an underground parking called Parking Astrid, just before the studio. U best use this parking for arrival. But for longer stay it is expensive. So better take your car to one of the Park & Rides ( P+R) , at the ring of Antwerp. Parking is for free there and you have direct access to the tram which takes you immediately to the center of town.

name: â˜˜ Modern loft with a splendid view
neighborhood_overview: De Vogeltjesmarkt is de afgelopen decennia getransformeerd tot een toeristische markt. Iedere zondag komen er duizenden voornamelijk Nederlandse en Belgische bezoekers naar de Antwerpse Theaterbuurt om tussen de honderden stand te wandelen. In veel gevallen komt men vooral om te sfeer te proeven. Serieus inkopen doen is niet altijd aan de orde. Het toeristische karakter is vooral duidelijk zichtbaar in het veranderde aanbod. Vogelen, pluimvee en knaagdieren koop je alleen nog maar in het hart van de Graanmarkt. Voor de rest zijn het vooral algemeen handelswaren, kleding, lekkernijen en accessoires wat je in de stands ziet. Naast nieuwe producten vind je ook kraampjes met antiek, brocante en tweedehands spullen op de Vogeltjesmarkt. Daarnaast is Opvallend is het toenemend aantal Nederlandse marktkooplui dat op de Vogeltjesmarkt staat.

name: Ground floor apartament with terras
neighborhood_overview: Appartment is 5 minutes by foot from the central station . 2 minutes by foot from the tram station that brings you on All Sites of Antwerp . 1 minutes by foot from the Pharmacies , docters, night shops . Supermarkt , Barber, etc Everything very close . just around the corner from Central Station and the Keyserlei with its numerous restaurants and cafes, the UGC cinema complex ... Since the reconstruction of the Keyserlei, a bicycle and pedestrian boulevard takes you from the Central Station to the old city center, with its Grand Place, Cathedral and Groenplaats, only 1.6 km (1 mile) from your bed. Metro Station 'Elisabeth' is just around the corner (100m), with bike rental stands next to it. Fun fact: Vincent Van Gogh lived in our street from 24 November 1885 until end of February 1886. Two of his paintings titled 'Lange Beeldekensstraat' are exhibited at the Vincent Van Gogh Museum in Amsterdam* I am a world cyclists myself and enjoy the stories and anecdotes of all travelers :) Break

name: Great apartment, top location in historical center
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to our rustic petit apartment in the historic city center of beautiful Antwerp.

The location is in Antwerp's student area, perfect in the middle between the "Grote markt" and the "Meir" - highstreet shopping.

It's a very quite street, but surroundend with nice little restaurants and bars and great shops.
Just around the corner of the Hendrik Conscience square with its beautifull buildings from the 17th century, a must visit!

From the apartment you can easily walk to the shopping, nightlife or theater district or to the docks ("kaaien").

Just a perfect spot to enjoy the beautifull city of Antwerp!

name: Verborgen parel in het historische centrum
neighborhood_overview:
Je bent op wandelafstand van alle toeristische attracties
De Grote Markt met het mooie stadhuis is net om de hoek, alsook shops, restaurants, musea, etc. Het Historisch Centrum is de wijk met veel bekende gebouwen en toeristische trekpleisters als de Grote Markt met het stadhuis, de kathedraal en de Groenplaats. Deze buurt vormt een combinatie van barokke bezienswaardigheden, charmante straatjes en pittoreske pleintjes. Tussen de historische gebouwen, de gezellige restaurants, cafÃ©s, terrasjes, winkels en musea is het gezellig wandelen.

name: stylish studio in a former trophy factory
neighborhood_overview:
Our Bnb is the ideal base for exploring Antwerp, it is located 5 minutes walk from tram stops / bus stops that will take you to all the sights in the city.
You are 200 meters from the Roma, a beautifully restored cinema room from 1928, which now serves as a party, theater and concert hall. Trix, Openluchtheater Rivierenhof, numerous restaurants, Zurenborg, and much more, all nearby!

name: Bright and modern studio apartment.
neighborhood_overview:
The appartment is located in between the Tentoonstellingswijk and Kiel. You'll be close to by far the most beautiful parks of Antwerp. In the Nachtegalenpark you can go for a run or a coffee and before you realise it, you'll be in the Middelheim park where there's a permanent outdoor art exhibition. Cross the street and you can continue your run or stroll in park Den Brandt where you can enjoy the famous Jazz Middelheim festival in August.
The neighbourhood is a truly divers example of Antwerp. Across the street you'll find a Marocan-Belgian bakery where you'll find both fresh msemen and typical Belgian buns on Sunday.

name: Enjoy Antwerp, stay in a charming apartment!
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in one of the nicest neighborhoods, only 10 minutes walk to "de Singel" if you want to pick a jazz concert, dance or theater show. There are 3 beautiful parks around the apartment, and beer brewery " De Koninck" is only 5 minutes walk. There are a few nice coffee bars in the streets around if you want to have a good breakfast to start the day. Also there is a bike stations right next to the building (Red Velo's) where you can pick a bike to get around. City center, shopping area's, museums and lots of unique landmark are only 15 min by bike, 30 min walk or 20 min by tram. Lots of nice (wine) bars and restaurants are so close, you can walk every where if you love to discover this beautiful city.

name: Charming and spacious apartment with sunny terrace
neighborhood_overview: In the apartment you will find a folder with all kinds of tips about the neighborhood! The apartment is 10 minutes walk from the central station and the zoo. You then walk along the Offerandestraat, which is a car-free shopping street, where you will also find the supermarket Albert Heyn. You can also shop in the Chinese street for typical Asian specialties, or in the regular supermarket there, which is located in an old market hall! In the other direction you walk further to Borgerhout, with the Turnhoutsebaan as axis along which you will find all kinds of parks, squares and eating and drinking places. Or you can walk further towards the Seefhoek, where you will find, among other things, beautiful Park Spoor Noord. Borgerhout and the Seefhoek are both authentic and lively neighborhoods of Antwerp.

name: The Red Monkey
neighborhood_overview: We can assure you that this is just the best neighborhood of Antwerp. Super central, a quiet street, close to public transfer and free parking Zuiderdokken, in the middle of the best shopping streets and within 10 minutes walking distance from the best restaurants, cafÃ©s and museums. The district is called Sint-Andries and it is located in the southern part of the city centre. The district is bordered by the "Historical Center" in the north, the "Theaterbuurt" in the east and "Het Zuid" in the south. Nowadays, it is the fashion centre of the city and a lot of famous Belgian designers are located here. Vintage, design, interior, fashion and boutiques are key words for what to find in this area.

name: The 16th century Horse Alley
neighborhood_overview:
You are staying in what is considered one of the best locations in Antwerp center. When you walk out and turn right, you come to Nationalestraat. Turn left and you will come to the area where the exclusive fashion designers of Antwerp are located. At the north end of that street is Groenplaats, that is the heart of Antwerp. Nearby the Meir starts, the most popular shopping street.

On the other side, if you walk out and turn left, there are two pubs on the corners. Both places are nice and cozy. Turn right at the pubs and down that street, you will find an antique shopping area where people go hunting for valuable vintage egg holders :-) This street will also lead you to Groenplaats and the cathedral of Antwerp.

neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of cafÃ©-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerpâ€™s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

There are two entrances to the Stadsfeestzaal, one at Meir 78 and one at Hopland 31, one street down from the Rubens House. name: Luxury Cathedral Duplex. Historic Center Antwerp
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of cafÃ©-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerpâ€™s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

neighborhood_overview:
The appartment is situated in a quiet but lively area. It's surrounded by 3 nice parks: Boelaerpark, Boekenbergpark and Rivierenhof. On the other side, it's only 1 km away from the famous Dageraadplaats and Draakplaats (Zurenborg) where you can enjoy nice food and typical Belgian beer in one of the uncountable cosy (coffee)bars and restaurants. Even closer (just around the corner), you'll definitely enjoy a drink at Bar Brul or a nice breakfast, coffee or lunch at CafÃ© Josee.
If you want to explore the center of Antwerp, it's just 4 km away and very easy to get there by tram, bus, bicycle or even by foot.

name: Theodore Lodge. Luxury Apartment Antwerp
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of cafÃ©-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerpâ€™s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: â™¥  Romantisch verblijf in hippe buurt
neighborhood_overview:
De buurt waarin het appartement gelegen is is een echte hippe,bruisende woonbuurt. Recent zijn er projecten geweest om onze buurt tevergroenen. Je vind hier allerlei fleurige bloemen in geveltuintjes en zelfs gevelslingers!

Op wandelafstand liggen de dageraadplaats, draakplaats, het moorkensplein en het mechelseplein. Op deze plekken kan je terecht voor een koffietje/pint&wijntje/Italiaans ijs of een gezellig restaurant. In het appartement ligt een opsomming van onze favorieten + tips voor activiteiten wat verder uit de buurt!

In de Roma (10min) kan je een concertje meepikken. In de Arenberg (25min) kan je genieten van een theater/comedy-avondje.

Er is een kringwinkel in de straat waar je naar schatten kan speuren.

Ook nog op wandelafstand vind je het stadspark. Met een prachtige vijver, en romantische brug.

name: Theaterstudio 2.0 Antwerp
neighborhood_overview: The studio is perfectly located for exploring the city. You will be right in the city center and in walking distance of the historic center, museums and the large shopping street (the Meir). There are many good restaurants and bars in the area. Also, the very popular neighborhood ''Het Zuid'' is close to the studio. On the corner of the street (1min walk) is a small supermarket providing basic things for your stay. On saturday and sunday is the famous ''Vogelenmarkt'' on the square at the end of the street, this big market full of food, clothing, flowers, animals and weird antiques is a perfect place to buy the best fresh vegetables and fruits during your stay!

The Loft is situated in the historical heart of the city, on a walking distance of all city highlights: MAS, Red Star Line Museum, FOMU, Museum of Modern Art, the Cathedral tower, Fashion Museum, the gorgeous Carolus Borromeus church, Meir shopping area but also the local boutiques and trendy fashion stores are nearby.

neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of cafÃ©-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerpâ€™s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

neighborhood_overview:
Our apartement is just a step away from "Het Eilandje", or so called â€œThe Little Island,â€
A few years ago, the city of Antwerp started a successful re-development of the old harbor district known as the legendary Schipperskwartierâ€
Today this neighborhood is a cozy place with a rich history and a limited well-kept and traffic-free tolerance zone for the oldest profession.
The city of Antwerp won the prize for the broad yet precise way in which it approached the red light district in recent years, both socially and spatially.
In the past decade, the harbor area has gone from scruffy maritime wasteland to foodie haven and museum central. Ask any local what prompted the change, and theyâ€™ll most likely point you to the MAS, a remarkable sandstone-colored construction. Today, the district boasts waterfront cafÃ©s, lofts and another successful museum, The Red Star Line, dedicated to the eponymous Antwerp cruiser company and the millions of emigrants it carried oversea

neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of cafÃ©-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerpâ€™s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Charming and cosy apartment in the old town
neighborhood_overview: Our airbnb is located in the city center  next to the historic neighbourhood and close to the Mas museum and Schelde river bank. The Eilandje, one of the nicest quarters in Antwerp, with his restaurants, harbour and museums is a 3 min walk, the iconic Havenhuis is 15 min further down the riverbank.  From the apartment you can walk straight to our lovely Cathedral,  in between the Groenplaats en Grote markt.  This is the heart of Antwerp. In this area you will find all the bars and restaurants, the diamond museum, the historic buildings surrounding the Grote markt.  If you walk further to the south the fashion district awaits you.    5 min to the north of the apartment, you can stroll along the river banks of the Schelde.  There are 2 supermarkets within 300m and a laundromat at 50m of the appartment.

name: Beautiful Loft Antwerp Old Town with unique view!
neighborhood_overview:
The loft is located in a monumental building in the heart of the historic center of Antwerp. From the roof terrace, you have a view of the Bourse of Antwerp, KBC tower, and the cathedral.

The shopping street the Meir and the Groenplaats are just around the corner at 150 meters.
You can walk to the town hall on the Grote Markt in 5 minutes. The MAS Museum can be reached on foot in less than 15 minutes.

Antwerpen Centrum is full of cozy restaurants, coffee bars, museums, shops . There is a small supermarket Delhaize 5min away. It's a safe and cozy neighborhood.

name: The Capital Street Lodge
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of cafÃ©-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerpâ€™s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Super cozy studio with amazing Kingsize bed
neighborhood_overview:
The location is superb; a quiet neighbourhood with 3 big supermarkets and smaller groceries within 5 min walk and fast access to both city centre and train station.
The studio is situated in a quiet side street with everything you need in a short, walkable distance. There is a butchery, cheese shop, bakery, several big supermarkets and pharmacy on Herentalsebaan (main street) all within 1-5 minutes walk.
You can reach several parks within 10 minutes walk. Boelaerpark & Boekenbergpark border to several organic/hipster coffeeshops. Rivierenhof is the biggest park with a huge lake where you can make nice walks and picnics.
There is a swimming pool within 10 minutes walk from the house.

neighborhood_overview: Located on the eastside of Central Station you can find the area of BORGERHOUT, a place where I now live for more than 10 years and which I really really love. Sharing the positive vibe of the district, its locals and all their wonderful initiatives is why I started my guesthouse right here, in the heart of 'BOHO' as we call it. The neighborhood is a mix of many different cultures, marked by a large Arabic population, so if you like North African/ Middle-East snackbars and shops, TURNHOUTSE BAAN is your place. Once you turn into one of the many smaller streets you will feel a creative and young atmosphere. As the neighborhood is up-and-coming you will discover lots of cozy squares with bars and restaurants, start-up and pop-up shops, DIY galleries and local entrepreneurs... A mix of local seniors, hipsters, young families, kids and some lucky tourist discovering this surprisingly other, personal and small-scaled side of Antwerp. name: Cozy & perfectly situated apartment in Zurenborg
neighborhood_overview:
Zurenborg might just be the prettiest little neighborhood of Antwerp. Its elegant streets and squares are filled with art-nouveau architecture.
It's a trendy neighborhood with a lot of young families. The belle-Ã©poque street Cogels-Osylei, the most expensive bit of real estate of Antwerp, is a must if you're into architecture.
The Dageraadplaats is a cozy square with lovely bars (such as the legendary Zeezicht) and restaurants. The surrounding streets and squares (such as Draakplaats) are also filled with great little places to visit.

name: Riverside Loft 150mÂ²
neighborhood_overview:
Cross the river
As Europeâ€™s second biggest port, the river Scheldt is Antwerpâ€™s lifeblood.
The Left Bank is an exceptional part of Antwerp. A major asset of Linkeroever is the open and green character. Summer pop-ups and epic city views.

De Molen is a big open air swimming pool on the left side of the river (Left Bank). It might not be the first place to come to mind when you want to go for a swim but it has a lot of charm and there is a lot to do: take a stroll on St. Anneke Beach, have a picnic and enjoy the most beautiful views you'll find in Antwerp.

Antwerp is full of surprises. Take its city beach, Saint Anneke, on the left bank, for example, where you can come for a walk, a nice meal or just to chillax.

Saint Anna Beach on the left bank refers to the former village of Saint Anna, when the beach was a popular attraction with many of the locals. They would typically come here by ferry to enjoy the famous mussels of Saint Anneke.

name: Vintage City house Antwerp
neighborhood_overview:
Dageraadplaats

De Dageraadplaats in de wijk Zurenborg is Ã©Ã©n van de gezelligste pleinen van Antwerpen. Aan het begin van de twintigste eeuw kwam de wijk tot stand als 'Beau Quartier' voor de middenklasse en de burgerij van de stad.

Onder meer de neogotische Norbertuskerk uit 1904 dateert uit deze tijd. In 2007 werd het plein in een nieuw trendy jasje gestoken en autovrij gemaakt. De oude bomen maakten plaats voor zilverlinden en het plein oogt met de nieuwe kasseien als een pleintje in de Provence.

De speeltoestellen zijn splinternieuw en wie even wil uitrusten, kan dat op trendy zitbankjes en -blokken met ingebouwde verlichting. Ook drinkfonteintjes zijn aanwezig op dit pittoreske plein. Al is water misschien niet de eerste keuze, vermits de hele Dageraadplaats omzoomd is met cafÃ©s en restaurants.

De innerlijke mens wordt uitvoerig verwend met een uitgebreide keuze van fastfood tot haute cuisine. Het bekendste en grootste cafÃ© is wellicht

name: BED in FUNKY COMFY 6-bed FEMALE DORM â€“ bed 1
neighborhood_overview: Located on the eastside of Central Station you can find the area of BORGERHOUT, a place where I now live for more than 10 years and which I really really love. Sharing the positive vibe of the district, its locals and all their wonderful initiatives is why I started my guesthouse right here, in the heart of 'BOHO' as we call it. The neighborhood is a mix of many different cultures, marked by a large Arabic population, so if you like North African/ Middle-East snackbars and shops, TURNHOUTSE BAAN is your place. Once you turn into one of the many smaller streets you will feel a creative and young atmosphere. As the neighborhood is up-and-coming you will discover lots of cozy squares with bars and restaurants, start-up and pop-up shops, DIY galleries and local entrepreneurs... A mix of local seniors, hipsters, young families, kids and some lucky tourist discovering this surprisingly other, personal and small-scaled side of Antwerp. Hope you feel as much at home as I do...Don't worry, I he

name: CHEERFUL and SUNNY FRIEND/FAMILY ROOM
neighborhood_overview: Located on the eastside of Central Station you can find the area of BORGERHOUT, a place where I now live for more than 10 years and which I really really love. Sharing the positive vibe of the district, its locals and all their wonderful initiatives is why I started my guesthouse right here, in the heart of 'BOHO' as we call it. The neighborhood is a mix of many different cultures, marked by a large Arabic population, so if you like North African/ Middle-East snackbars and shops, TURNHOUTSE BAAN is your place. Once you turn into one of the many smaller streets you will feel a creative and young atmosphere. As the neighborhood is up-and-coming you will discover lots of cozy squares with bars and restaurants, start-up and pop-up shops, DIY galleries and local entrepreneurs... A mix of local seniors, hipsters, young families, kids and some lucky tourist discovering this surprisingly other, personal and small-scaled side of Antwerp. Hope you feel as much at home as I do...Don't worry, I he

name: PrivÃ©kamer heel goed bereikbaar met tram-bus-trein
neighborhood_overview:
Wat Hoboken zo uniek maakt. Het is het meest groene district van Antwerpen, vlakbij het centrum van Antwerpen en gemakkelijk bereikbaar met openbaar vervoer. Je kan fietsjes huren om de groene omgeving te verkennen of een ritje maken naar het centrum van Antwerpen. Het cultureel centrum en Fort van Hoboken , Vlakbij vind je alles wat je in het dagelijks leven nodig hebt. Een bakker , beenhouwer, grootwarenhuis
De populariteit van Antwerpen zit hem in een zeer groot aantal facetten, die niet Ã©Ã©n twee drie samen te vatten zijn. Feit is dat de stad veel te bieden heeft en zelden verveelt. Het maakt niet uit met welk doel je Antwerpen bezoekt. Op de een of andere manier weet de stad je altijd weer te pakken en te verbazen. Zeker als je je openstelt voor de onbekende plekken en probeert Antwerpen te ervaren in plaats van te bezoeken. Van hart welkom!!

name: Beautiful room Camille in authentic master house
neighborhood_overview:
Onze woning is de ideale uitvalsbasis als u Antwerpen wil beleven in alle facetten die de stad rijk is:

WATER: Op 300m van onze deur kunt u gaan uitwaaien of joggen op de kaaien langs de rivier Schelde. De jachthaven en boottochten zijn eveneens op wandelafstand

CULTUUR: Bij ons slaapt u bijna "onder de toren" van de Sint-Pauluskerk. Neem zeker hier een kijkje waar u nog schilderijen van Rubens, Jordaens,... kan bewonderen. Verder kan u op nog geen 600m de rijke geschiedenis van Antwerpen opsnuiven in het MAS en de oude stadskern.

ETEN & DRINKEN: In de directe omgeving vindt u talrijke terrasjes om te genieten van een Antwerps biertje of lekker eten. Om de hoek vindt u tal van restaurants, bistro en het sterrenrestaurant Nathan. Graag adviseren we u bij uw keuze.

Wij bieden zelf geen ontbijt aan, maar graag bevelen we u enkele ontbijtrestaurants aan op nog geen 5 minuten wandelen.

name: B&B Borgerhouse Antwerp Central Station Borgerhout
neighborhood_overview:
B&B Borgerhouse is located in the heart of Borgerhout (Antwerp), on the traffic-free Moorkensplein.

The ideal base to explore Antwerp and its surroundings from a different angle. The Moorkensplein was beautifully redeveloped a few years ago and is an attraction in the super-diverse Borgerhouse. Restaurants and shops nearby.

Antwerp Central Station, Antwerp Zoo, De Roma arts centre or Zeno X art gallery are all within walking distance. Just like the trendy Zurenborg with its listed Belle Epoque houses on the Cogels-Osylei and its cosy terraces on the Dageraadplaats. The Sportpaleis, the MAS and Park Spoor Noord are within cycling distance.

name: SHWAY60 Family House
neighborhood_overview: We can assure you that this is just the best neighborhood of Antwerp. Super central, a quiet street, close to public transfer and free parking Zuiderdokken, in the middle of the best shopping streets and within 10 minutes walking distance from the best restaurants, cafÃ©s and museums. The district is called Sint-Andries and it is located in the southern part of the city centre. The district is bordered by the "Historical Center" in the north, the "Theaterbuurt" in the east and "Het Zuid" in the south. Nowadays, it is the fashion centre of the city and a lot of famous Belgian designers are located here. Vintage, design, interior, fashion and boutiques are key words for what to find in this area.

name: spacious and light apartment in Antwerp
neighborhood_overview: Leuke activiteiten in deze Harmonie wijk: 2 parkjes op 8 minuten wandelen. In de zomer komen locals daar verkoeling zoeken. Brouwerij De Koninck is niet alleen een brouwerij: er is een restaurant, een rooftop cocktail bar, bakkerij, een slager ... alles van topkwaliteit. Je kan natuurlijk ook een gegidste rondleiding in de brouwerij zelf boeken. Wat verder is er de site van PAKT waar lokale hipsters koffie komen drinken in Caffenation, waar je vele belgische bieren kan gaan proeven (inclusief proefplankje) in 'cafe Speciale Belge'. Er zijn ook enkele restaurants. Wil je eerder de richting van het historische centrum uit, dan ben je ook weer snel bij enkele hotspots. Na een klein kwartier wandelen ben je al aan het mechelseplein waar enkele leuke cafeetjes zijn. Nog wat verder ben je in het midden van het historisch centrum: de huidevetterstraat, de kathedraal, de grote markt,  Meir etc.

neighborhood_overview:
Happert House is located in the middle of the historical part of Antwerp. There are unlimited bars and restaurants to discover such as Sir Anthony Van Dijck, which is one of the most famous restaurants with Michelin stars.

If you fancy art and culture, all the important museums and theatrehalls are within walking distance.  Want to go shopping? No problem! One street away from the House Happaert starts the fashion street for youngsters but also the chic boutiques like Dries Van Noten. There are activities for the entire family!

Transport will not be any problem while visiting Happert House because trams, trains, taxis and bicycles are to be found just around the corner.

name: Lichtrijke studio in Art-nouveau buurt!
neighborhood_overview:
Zeer mooie buurt met Art-nouveau huizen. Dichtbij gezellige pleintjes met gezellige terrasjes waar je lekker kan eten en drinken. De twee lekkerste bakkers van 't stad (Aldo en Dome) op minder dan 1 km wandelen. Lidl op wandelafstand, twee grote supermarkten Delhaize op fietsafstand. Parkeren in de straat is tegen betaling, maar zo goed als altijd plek! (Weektarief in de straat +-70 EUR/week
of alternatief weektarief 2 straten verder +-28 EUR/week). Op de hoek heb je een velo-station. Handig om overal naartoe te fietsen (weektarief +-10 EUR). Best op voorhand reserveren. Meer info vind je op https://www.velo-antwerpen.be/.

name: Unieke woning in Lillo (Antwerpen)
neighborhood_overview:
Als beschermd patrimonium en met slecht 50 inwoners heeft Lillo een uniek en romantisch karakter. Er zijn 2 bars en een uitstekend restaurant.
De grote supermarkten vind je op 10' rijden.
Het is de perfecte uitvalsbasis voor Antwerpen: 25' met de auto of nog veel leuker met de waterbus (vertrekt elk half uur aan de steiger in Lillo: geen kans op file, geen parkeerproblemen, geen parkeerkosten en een heerlijke manier om de stad binnen te komen).
Op een half uurtje rijden vind je het Verdronken Land van Saeftinghe: een onvergetelijke wandelervaring.
Lillo is een goed vertrekpunt voor uitstappen naar Gent, Brugge, Brussel, Rotterdam en Amsterdam. Prachtige wandelingen en fietstochten in Zeeland.
(15' rijden naar de Nederlandse grens).

name: One of a kind skyview apartment overlooking MAS in Antwerp
neighborhood_overview:
Just north of the Schipperskwartier, the old harbor district "Het Eilandje" gets its second chance. The port activities here give way to water tourism and a spectacular urban renewal process. Between the Scheldt, the old picturesque docks and the new Park Spoor Noord, the city council and project developers are building an attractive neighborhood near water and greenery. You are truly an eyewitness to a metamorphosis here!

Along a beautiful pedestrian quay you can admire the mighty pedestrian boulevard of the MAS, the Museum aan de Stroom. A little further you will find some historic warehouses that were given a new function such as the FelixArchief. Het Eilandje is slowly but surely developing into a pleasant oasis of water, space, beautiful contemporary architecture, cozy terraces and culture.

name: Cosy appartment in the heart of Antwerp
neighborhood_overview:
Nice places to visit:

This cosy apartment is located 10 minutes walking from the central station in a social and cultural area.

Next to the station you can visit the Zoo of Antwerp - https://www.zooantwerpen.be/nl/.

Here also starts the main shopping street that leads you to the historical center with good restaurants and a view on â€œDe Scheldeâ€, river and the port lying next to city.

When you are here you can choose to go the cultural South or the student and harbour area in the North. Both sides have interesting bars and other places worthy to visit.

5 minutes walking from my place you have Zurenborg, a modern area with very good restaurants and bars.

Finally you can visit the central park which is located 5 minutes walking from my place.

name: DÃ© Penthouse, oase van licht en inspiratie.
neighborhood_overview:
De Belegstraat ligt in de wijk van de Brederode. Deze interessante en bruisende buurt ligt tussen het Zuid en de Markgrave. Dit is de meest diverse buurt van Antwerpen: je vindt er de hipste koffiebars, parken, musea, theater maar je kan er ook de beste Durum eten.

Na 10 minuten stappen ben je aan het historische centrum (boerentoren, kathedraal). Evengoed ben je na tien minuten stappen aan het harmoniepark. Alles ligt binnen handbereik, zeker gegeven de verschillende vervoersmogelijkheden.

In de directe buurt zijn volgende zaken een echte aanrader:

- koffiebar Nordica - scandinavische lunch en heerlijke koffie
- brasserie Walrus - Franse keuken op zijn heerlijkst
- theater De Monty - altijd weer een beleving

Na een kleine wandeling bevelen we tevens aan:

- de Kloosterstraat - de mooiste antiekstraat van Antwerpen
- het Zuid - bruisend van horeca en het MSK

name: The Old Town Lodge
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgiumâ€™s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europeâ€™s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens.
